intro: Uncaria uraiensis, commonly known as the Uraian climbing vine, is a species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, globose berries that contain several seeds. Due to its medicinal properties, it is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
